thread.title: $A higher, helped by positive US data
thread.title_full: $A higher, helped by positive US data

title: $A higher, helped by positive US data
text:
Wed, Sep 30, 2015, 10:50 AM NZDT - New Zealand Markets close in 6 hrs 10 mins $A higher, helped by positive US data AAP â€“ 15 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar has bounced from its recent lows helped by some encouraging US consumer confidence figures. 
At 0700 AEST on Wednesday, the local unit was trading at 69.85 US cents, up from 69.47 cents on Tuesday. 
On Tuesday, it hit a low of 69.37 US cents, its weakest level in almost four weeks, after the Australian share market plunged more than three per cent, weighed down by a sell-off in resources stocks. 
Westpac strategist Imre Speizer said US economic data helped Wall Street recover after it spent most of its session in negative territory. 
The US consumer confidence index had risen to 103.0, despite the market expecting a sharp drop in sentiment. 
"Risk appetite improved slightly after Asia's heavy equity losses, with only modest sell-offs in Europe and North America," he said. 
"The strong US consumer confidence data helped the mood somewhat." 
Mr Speizer said the better market mood overnight should help the Australian dollar post modest gains on Wednesday. 
"This should help Australian dollar hold above 69.40 US cents that has formed support twice in the past week," he said. 
The key focus for local markets on Wednesday will be the release of official building approvals figures for August. 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 0700 AEST ON WEDNESDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 69.85 US cents, from 69.47 cents on Tuesday 
* 83.63 Japanese yen, from 83.03 yen 
* 62.09 euro cents, from 61.68 euro cents 
* 110.14 New Zealand cents, from 110.19 NZ cents 
* 46.10 British pence, from 45.82 pence 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
